commit_message:
Rename duplicated class name AttachVolumeMultiAttachTest

Class name AttachVolumeMultiAttachTest is duplicated in
api.compute.admin.test_volume_swap.py and
api.compute.volumes.test_attach_volume.py, which is not
good for code readability, so this is to rename
test_volume_swap.AttachVolumeMultiAttachTest
to a more suitable name "TestMultiAttachVolumeSwap".

Change-Id: I079d54a6bf05dc4ce3a217236b6f7c42470bc479

[{'created': '2018-03-08 12:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: enabled fake-hardware and fake interfaces

commit_message:
devstack: enabled fake-hardware and fake interfaces

We currently enable the fake classic driver by default, so it makes
sense to enable fake-hardware now that the classic drivers are
deprecated. It will be used in the updated ironic-inspector
discovery CI job.

Change-Id: I42e72312821b2d3c002f16fbf8b4faa26b4853b3

commit_message:
Enable py35 tempest jobs for CephFS

Enable CephFS (native and nfs) Python 3.5 tempest jobs
as non-voting. This will enable us to test
py3 compatibility for our integration test suite.

Change-Id: I5fe1a941637d2bb0870fb26d052252e91bf65770

commit_message:
Add dvr_no_external l3 dvr agent mode

This patch introduces inner-compute and external-compute nodes
group to distinguish compute nodes which do not have external
reachability from compute nodes which can reach outside.

Co-Authored-By: jinke <jin.ke@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: yong sheng gong <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>

Change-Id: I45b945f7885e8243b017cf8607cbd7f9827cb6e9
Closes-bug: #1722026

commit_message:
Remove the heat upgrade steps for Q upgrade workflow

This removes most of the Heat driver upgrade workflow, including
the script delivery and stepwise upgrade tasks with invocation
of ansible via heat

For Q upgrades the operator should use
    openstack overcloud upgrade --init-upgrade --container-registry-file file
    openstack overcloud upgrade --nodes Controller
etc.

Depends-On: I54f8fc57b758e34c620d607be15d2291d545ff6f
Change-Id: I75f087dc456c50327c3b4ad98a1f89a7e012dc68
(cherry picked from commit 5cbe298f595d536c9d2155ce6f5820d1d66e5e22)

commit_message:
Specify MTU in bifrost configdrive network_data.json

This ensures that the network interface configuration applied by
cloud-init/glean honours the provisioning network's MTU.

Change-Id: Ic06da06901bac304e2a9ce3690471c9d4eed0c16

commit_message:
FFU: Fix Cinder services action order

We should try to disable pacemaker resource and shut down services
in step 1 and make sure we check running services only once.

Change-Id: I5676132be477695838c59a0d59c62e09e335a8f0
(cherry picked from commit 5038364cb2072d3d8cacc12aef176717f0ee9a01)

role. gnocchi-upgrade seems to be racy and we sometimes end up with the
following error:

  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1182, in _execute_context
    context)

commit_message:
Fix gnocchi-upgrade Table <..> already exists errors

Currently we are calling /usr/bin/gnocchi-upgrade
--sacks-number=SACK_NUM from each node where gnocchi-api is part of the
role. gnocchi-upgrade seems to be racy and we sometimes end up with the
following error:

2018-03-14 12:39:39,683 [1] ERROR    oslo_db.sqlalchemy.exc_filters: DBAPIError exception wrapped from (pymysql.err.InternalError) (1050, u"Table 'archive_policy' already exists") [SQL: u'\nCREATE TABLE archive_policy (\n\tname VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, \n\tback_window INTEGER NOT NULL, \n\tdefinition TEXT NOT NULL, \n\taggregation_methods TEXT NOT NULL, \n\tPRIMARY KEY (name)\n)ENGINE=InnoDB CHARSET=utf8\n\n']
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1182, in _execute_context
    context)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 470, in do_execute
    cursor.execute(statement, parameters)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/cursors.py", line 166, in execute
    result = self._query(query)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/cursors.py", line 322, in _query
    conn.query(q)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 856, in query
    self._affected_rows = self._read_query_result(unbuffered=unbuffered)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 1057, in _read_query_result
    result.read()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 1340, in read
    first_packet = self.connection._read_packet()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 1014, in _read_packet
    packet.check_error()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/connections.py", line 393, in check_error
    err.raise_mysql_exception(self._data)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pymysql/err.py", line 107, in raise_mysql_exception
    raise errorclass(errno, errval)
InternalError: (1050, u"Table 'archive_policy' already exists")

Let's run it from a the bootstrap node by wrapping it into the
bootstrap_host_exec magic.

Change-Id: I106512eeffff3425608a543f9bc5e6a9508d15e5
Closes-Bug: #1755564
(cherry picked from commit 1d704d4733768dc7d502d6cccaf083c6382e1edd)

commit_message:
Switch horizon UT from mox to mock

This completes mock migration in horizon UT.

IsA and IsHttpRequest are moved to horizon.test.helpers
as they are genric enough and IsA is needed in a horizon UT.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I702551fe900224c9ebbbf3ef815206be035b6d14

[{'created': '2018-03-13 02:48:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove error of forms.fileds with 'switched' when they invisible

Class 'switchable' can switch forms.fields with class 'switched'
and attribute 'data-switch-on' visible or invisible.
When the fields are invisible,they should not be checked anymore.
So, we remove the errors about them.

[{'created': '2018-03-16 06:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Correct is_container when deploying containers

The is_container option was not be set or correctly interpreted. This
change sets the option when the openstack_host role is run on
containers.

Example host specific tasks running on containers unnecessarily:
  http://logs.openstack.org/36/553636/2/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/3805c3f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-16_02_31_02_897102

Change-Id: Ic90ae64dc00802154bf51831f4ed459d945600b9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Correct is_container when deploying containers

The is_container option was not be set or correctly interpreted. This
change sets the option when the openstack_host role is run on
containers.

Example host specific tasks running on containers unnecessarily:
  http://logs.openstack.org/36/553636/2/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/3805c3f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-16_02_31_02_897102

Change-Id: Ic90ae64dc00802154bf51831f4ed459d945600b9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Support copying TLS cert bundles into place

This commit handles deployment of TLS certificates on control nodes for
use by HAProxy, when kolla_enable_tls_external is True and a new
variable, kolla_tls_cert, is populated with the contents of the
certificate file.

Story: 2001680
Task: 6786

Change-Id: I78df9e2d7acb96a4358ba3819a2dfc65e8c261d5

commit_message:
tests: add more unit tests for qinling.orchestrator

This commit improves the unit tests coverage by covering branches and
exceptions in internal helper methods in the module of
qinling.orchestrator.

commit_message:
Use blkid instead of hexdump to get mbr disk id

This removes the dependency on hexdump from ironic-lib and therefore
IPA. This should allow us to consistently retreive the disk id for
images written to disk by IPA and the direct deploy method.

Change-Id: I7de47595bb884ca15902e96c5fe14917e6358543

commit_message:
Add support to build 2.8.2 image

Also tweak Hive a bit and refer to artifacts in a new (but not totally
ideal) location.

Co-Authored-By: Jeremy Freudberg <jeremyfreudberg@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixing multi-region support in templated v3 catalog

Previously each region had its own entry for each service_type
with only it's own endpoints listed. This patch changes this
so that each service type has the endpoints from all regions
listed.

We also move the flawed templated get_v3_catalog function call
from the base catalog class into the templated class.

Change-Id: Ifddf08990539b6ac7d8289d410092b2ae9f5cbed
Closes-Bug: #1703666

commit_message:
Use OSC in application credential documentation

With support for application credentials landed on
python-openstackclient, update the documentation to use this more
user-friendly method of managing application credentials.

Change-Id: I0c05d5a276a6aeb6cc464420ca8c529ed00e4b45
Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/536163

I think this change opens pandora box for the new library. The whole reason why we moved from -legacy was that we will have something really simple and tiny that will work by default, and advanced customizations will belong to job definitions that will use localrc post-config sections to tweak resulting config files.'}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2017-09-20 18:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Some background on lib/neutron: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/094063.html
Quoting:
The basic reasoning for this is, the current lib/neutron-legacy has tons
of knobs for plugging veths into things, creating provider networks,
etc.. - those things are very specific to a deployment or networking
type, so they should be moved into a plugin so they don't gunk up the
main code path and also avoid trampling one another (like they do
today)."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2017-09-20 19:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-09-20 19:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

On second thought, the end goal will be to have dvr support by default (and ha too) in the library. So we will need some knob to enable it, at least for the time of transition. I am just not sure if we want to expose agent modes here, or instead introduce some more general knob like DISTRIBUTED_ROUTING=False, and hardcode/pick default agent mode for users.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-09-20 19:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add DVR support to lib/neutron

Added NEUTRON_DISTRIBUTED_ROUTING to more easily control DVR
configuration.  If set to True, DVR will be enabled and the
default agent mode will be set to 'dvr_snat' since that works
with all types of routers by default.  Advanced users can
override that by setting NEUTRON_DVR_MODE, for example in
multi-node configurations where different agent modes are
desired.

This should bring lib/neutron inline with lib/neutron-legacy
in supporting all the different DVR modes.

Change-Id: I9f25921eefc5b935aad3bb1edc5e41ee0ce43a84

directory instead of using the etc/ directory in the venv. Otherwise, the

commit_message:
Modify the etc directory in default/main

Following the example of other roles, we will use /etc/tacker as the conf.
directory instead of using the etc/ directory in the venv. Otherwise, the
permission handling gets a bit messy because the venv gets deleted and
recreated, so the creation of tacker directories should happen after that,
which will change the role structure a bit

Change-Id: Ie052dd7680218e31ed5a6e405db4167ee37471a8
(cherry picked from commit 9fed11c01ed9598798788b3c64b024995edd4876)

commit_message:
tests: add unit tests for qinling.orchestrator

This commit adds unit tests for exposed methods in qinling.orchestrator.
This commit only covers branches and exceptions found in the exposed
methods. Those in internal helper functions would be covered by a
following patch.

Change-Id: I47df26435d93a3dc310314252cd20e624b4d0bb2

commit_message:
zun rebuild on local node

Provide reconstruction function, if the container A is damaged,
users can use this function to recreate a container B.
The container B and A use the same resources, such as network, CPU, etc.

Change-Id: Ie51bf68f5f94d847596ce17cecf5550bbdd97ac8
Implements:blueprint zun-rebuild-on-local-node

commit_message:
Deprecate running kuryr-k8s without kuryr-daemon

This commit implements what was discussed on the PTG, i.e. deprecation
of running Kuryr-Kubernetes without kuryr-daemon services. This commit
includes changes in configuration defaults, sample local.conf files,
documentation, gates and a release note explaining the change.

Change-Id: I152c81797cb83237af4917a4487cb1f1918270aa

commit_message:
ScaleIO: Add documentation for containerized overcloud

When running a containerized overcloud, an additional
step is needed to map in the directories containing the
ScaleIO SDC components.

Change-Id: Iaa304ad80a84c3a649d53d519de0630c477a3429

commit_message:
Only try to stop services that exist

Test for the presence of services before trying to stop them.
Avoids a delay during initial deploy.

Change-Id: Id3ccba83a402074af77b62f67754a834d6f765b7

[{'created': '2018-03-07 13:35:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

BOOTSTRAP_OPTS was surrounded by " ", which meant it would evaluate to:
-e 'BOOTSTRAP_OPTS', this became problematic if you wanted to add more
than one value.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix BOOTSTRAP_OPTS

BOOTSTRAP_OPTS was surrounded by " ", which meant it would evaluate to:
-e 'BOOTSTRAP_OPTS', this became problematic if you wanted to add more
than one value.

By removing the " " this is resolved.

Change-Id: I1351fddbdfd09f0a1a5eeef4afb44679bd39cd63

commit_message:
Create lockfiles directory in CNI Dockerfile

This commit adds creating a directory for lockfiles in the CNI Docker
image. As in oslo.concurrency `lock_path` option defaults to
`OSLO_LOCK_PATH` environment variable, this variable is also set to
point to that directory.

Change-Id: Ia69c75c34a8da4281414395805f4927de1e91a39
Closes-Bug: 1754636
(cherry picked from commit fce174b7f995973c04579e098d6d4ff3374e7ed9)

subject: Make concatenation of shard listings more robust
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-14 14:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-14 17:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-15 20:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-15 20:34:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

It's worth mentioning that if ranges overlap then the algorithm here will result in a reverse listing not being the reverse of a forwards listing because different overlaps are preferred in each direction.

However, I'm not too concerned about ironing that out because I don't yet expect overlpaaing ranges. The real value in this patch is tolerating empty and 404 responses."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-15 21:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

I think I managed to convince myself of why it makes sense to use greater-than/less-than with marker but includes with end_marker... It has to do with the previous shard range not returning *any* objects, yeah?'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-16 09:46:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

> 'It has to do with the previous shard range not returning *any* objects, yeah?'

yes. If we have found objects then the marker is simply the last object (with this patch). But if no objects had been found the marker would previously snap to the lower bound of the next shard range, thus excluding any misplaced bonus objects that might have been picked up from the previous shard range."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 14:45:03.000000000', 'message': 'Make concatentaion of shard listings more robust

When building concatenated listings from shard ranges, tolerate
shard ranges that overlap and empty shard range listings.

Also continue to build a listing despite a shard container GET
response not succeeding.

Drive-by fix: do not apply client limit param when fetching
shard ranges.

Change-Id: Ia4e1f828e164b5eccc6eaebff103ce2328b44bea
'}, {'created': '2018-03-14 16:51:12.000000000', 'message': 'Make concatenation of shard listings more robust

When building concatenated listings from shard ranges, tolerate shard
ranges that overlap and empty shard range listings.

Also continue to build a listing despite a shard container GET
response not succeeding.

Drive-by fix: do not apply client limit param when fetching shard
ranges.

Drive-by fix: for an unconstrained listing, set X-Container-Bytes-Used
equal to the sum of the object sizes in the returned listing, similar
to the object count as per [1].

[1] Related-Change: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728

Change-Id: Ia4e1f828e164b5eccc6eaebff103ce2328b44bea
'}, {'created': '2018-03-15 20:30:27.000000000', 'message': "Make concatenation of shard listings more robust

When building concatenated listings from shard ranges, tolerate shard
ranges that overlap and tolerate empty shard range listings.

Don't force the marker ahead to the next shard range lower (or upper
if reverse listing); if the next shard range has any misplaced objects
between the marker its lower bound (or upper bound if reverse listing)
then these will now be included in the listing.

Also continue to build a listing despite a shard container GET
response not succeeding.

Drive-by fix: do not apply client limit param when fetching shard
ranges.

Drive-by fix: for an unconstrained listing, set X-Container-Bytes-Used
equal to the sum of the object sizes in the returned listing, similar
to the object count as per [1].

[1] Related-Change: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728

Change-Id: Ia4e1f828e164b5eccc6eaebff103ce2328b44bea
"}]
commit_message:
Make concatenation of shard listings more robust

When building concatenated listings from shard ranges, tolerate shard
ranges that overlap and tolerate empty shard range listings.

Don't force the marker ahead to the next shard range lower (or upper
if reverse listing); if the next shard range has any misplaced objects
between the marker its lower bound (or upper bound if reverse listing)
then these will now be included in the listing.

Also continue to build a listing despite a shard container GET
response not succeeding.

Drive-by fix: do not apply client limit param when fetching shard
ranges.

Drive-by fix: for an unconstrained listing, set X-Container-Bytes-Used
equal to the sum of the object sizes in the returned listing, similar
to the object count as per [1].

[1] Related-Change: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728

Change-Id: Ia4e1f828e164b5eccc6eaebff103ce2328b44bea

commit_message:
Allows Configuration of Additional of Lbaas and Neutron

Using this, users can assign already available parameters
such as ovs_use_veth in lbaas_agent.ini and
ovs_integration_bridge in neutron.conf

Depends-On: I023e0476e574d5a4c13d66da390aa13016566058
Change-Id: I899fe9217cccbbf80113c74a77cc70961fe40f42
Closes-Bug: 1752918
(cherry picked from commit bbf0e9b1a0cd7c3865e87e48f89a7a0e0def5251)

commit_message:
Modify the etc directory in default/main

Following the example of other roles, we will use /etc/tacker as the conf.
directory instead of using the etc/ directory in the venv. Otherwise, the
permission handling gets a bit messy because the venv gets deleted and
recreated, so the creation of tacker directories should happen after that,
which will change the role structure a bit

Change-Id: Ie052dd7680218e31ed5a6e405db4167ee37471a8

I agree with that, but I think we should add more testing with our tagfilter strategy to make it very useful.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-12 19:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-12 21:23:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-13 21:15:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Is this still an issue with https://review.openstack.org/547771 merged? The entire task file is tagged 'always'. That's perhaps not the best approach and should be revised, but I don't see this patch in isolation actually achieving anything."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-03-14 05:32:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Is this still an issue with https://review.openstack.org/547771
 > merged? The entire task file is tagged 'always'. That's perhaps not
 > the best approach and should be revised, but I don't see this patch
 > in isolation actually achieving anything.

this patch in isolation does very little however because of the general always tag some variables may not be generated and in this case the change is just a guard to ensure the task is not executed unless it has the required information."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-16 08:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-08 23:37:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix role when running with isolated tags

This change adds a condition to the prep task so that it will skip if
the "lxc_images" variable is undefined. This is being done so that the
role can be executed in isolation using various tags.

Change-Id: I0aab69b41a74df7168d975eb2c8f3b8000fd2027
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix role when running with isolated tags

This change adds a condition to the prep task so that it will skip if
the "lxc_images" variable is undefined. This is being done so that the
role can be executed in isolation using various tags.

Change-Id: I0aab69b41a74df7168d975eb2c8f3b8000fd2027
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Increase the post-timeout to 3600 seconds

The default post-timeout is 1800, which is not enough to push images to
hub.docker.com.

Change-Id: If1e499c247f3eeb8452991cb18aea5b1fdad60a7
Closes-Bug: #1755416

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 741, 'name': 'Kiall Mac Innes', 'email': 'kiall@macinnes.ie', 'username': 'kiall'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 15736, 'name': 'Ritesh Anand', 'email': 'tellrit@gmail.com', 'username': 'ritesh'}, {'_account_id': 19298, 'name': 'Nicolas Bock', 'email': 'nicolas.bock@canonical.com', 'username': 'nicolasbock'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15736, 'date': '2018-01-12 20:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19298, 'date': '2018-01-12 21:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-01-16 14:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-16 07:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-16 11:18:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not an expert in using python classes, but repeating the same code so many times does look wrong to me. Isn't there a way to achieve the same thing with less repetition, maybe by inserting an intermediate class?"}, {'account_id': 15736, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Jens Harbott,  I agree there is a lot of repetition, but I could not find a better way of doing this.

In my earlier attempt at fixing this, I had introduced this change in the base class: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/464087/
But later we ran into this issue again, and then looking a little deeper into it I learned that to make the change effective, each class should call the classmethod "setup_credentials" explicitly, as resource allocation will happen at class level.

If there is a cleaner way, I would be happy to redo this; kindly point me in the right direction.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-03-16 05:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-16 06:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-12 20:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'Do not create network resources for API tests

We need to call set_network_resources() from class with API tests, to
avoid creating network resources. Which are not needed for API tests.

Change-Id: Ia93303390d9887722fa2cfde7757e5e9103ae585
Closes-Bug: #1689415
'}]
commit_message:
Do not create network resources for API tests

We need to call set_network_resources() from class with API tests, to
avoid creating network resources. Which are not needed for API tests.

Change-Id: Ia93303390d9887722fa2cfde7757e5e9103ae585
Closes-Bug: #1689415

If I've done things correctly, I believe I've executed tests in a cloud running images build with this change. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-22 23:05:21.000000000', 'message': "arm64: use HWE kernel and fix console

Install hwe kernel for ubuntu-minimal.  As noted this is currently
Xenial specific; we need this for initial bring-up so let's tackle
future releases as things progress.

Ensure we use ttyAMA0 for arm64 console too.

Change-Id: Ic607cf8369666dc24929aff6f2ef8a72e7980599
"}]
commit_message:
arm64: use HWE kernel and fix console

Install hwe kernel for ubuntu-minimal.  As noted this is currently
Xenial specific; we need this for initial bring-up so let's tackle
future releases as things progress.

Ensure we use ttyAMA0 for arm64 console too.

Change-Id: Ic607cf8369666dc24929aff6f2ef8a72e7980599

[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-31 23:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-31 23:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-31 23:50:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-01 00:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-01 05:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-01 06:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-01 06:44:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This is still very WIP ... but I have managed to create a x86-based efi ubuntu image and booted it with

 disk-image-create block-device-efi vm ubuntu-minimal

i then booted the resulting .qcow2 with virt-manager, where you can select efi as the bios if you have the ovmf package installed

@Marcin -- thank you!  notes in https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/dib-efi have been very helpful in bringing up my understanding on this.

i'm open to suggestions on the model of the block-device-* elements.  personally i like the way it avoids us having yet-more-environment-flags and gives us a way to document things with the readme's etc a bit better.

the bootloader element is full of years of cruft ... hopefully we can significantly prune it ..."}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 01:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 02:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 03:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 03:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 03:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

with this I was able to build an image on an xenial arm64 host with

 disk-image-create -x  block-device-efi vm ubuntu-minimal'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-06 05:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-08 05:51:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

using this patch i have a building, booting arm64 xenial image including with the infra elements.

there is something up with glean and the configdrive setup, but it's close!"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-13 19:47:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

re previous message -- the configdrive turned out to work much better with the hwe kernel, which seems to load the scsi/cdrom drivers (a modprobe of them on the base kernel didn't work, but i didn't really investigate).

i also fixed up the serial/console output which i need to make a change for"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-02-22 23:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-16 07:14:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

this has been building arm64 images in linaro for about 2 weeks, with no issues.  jobs are also running.  so let's work from here."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 23:39:36.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Choose appropriate bootloader for block-device

In the prior change we added block-device-[mbr|gpt|efi] elements to
create appropriate disk-layouts.

This adds an environment flag to each so the bootloader can install
the right thing.  The EFI install path is updated to work with this
(this part a copy of I572937945adbb5adaa5cb09200752e323c2c9531)

We do some basic sanity checking in the block-device elements;
e.g. mbr is not suitable for aarch64, and efi is not suitable for
power.

Co-Authored-By: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Change-Id: Ib80acbfd9a12efd976c3fa15a5d1081eb0799305

commit_message:
Choose appropriate bootloader for block-device

In the prior change we added block-device-[mbr|gpt|efi] elements to
create appropriate disk-layouts.

This adds an environment flag to each so the bootloader can install
the right thing.  The EFI install path is updated to work with this
(this part a copy of I572937945adbb5adaa5cb09200752e323c2c9531)

We do some basic sanity checking in the block-device elements;
e.g. mbr is not suitable for aarch64, and efi is not suitable for
power.

This updates the bootloader to install EFI where appropriate

Co-Authored-By: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Change-Id: Ib80acbfd9a12efd976c3fa15a5d1081eb0799305

commit_message:
Add block-device defaults

This moves the block-device default out of the "vm" element and into a
selection of other elements.  There's "mbr" which retains the status
quo.  There's an EFI version that has the boot/grub partitions as
required.  In between there's the GPT only version, which is useful
for architectures like power without EFI, but still want possible
larger disks using GPT.

Change-Id: I4a566a97d073fc0dda0ab2494ac988fe015800a9

commit_message:
Fail if two elements provide the same thing

The current check only validates that an element that specifies
"element-provides" doesn't conflict with a "real" element.  We also
want to check this against the provides of other elements.

A real example is with a "block-device" element.  There is no actual
"block-device" element; we can have multiple elements provide it
(block-device-[gpt,mbr,efi], say) but we only want one of them at a
time.

Update the unit test for this.

Change-Id: I59d4aa5f6f09e2892b213e154befa10d85e95ca3

commit_message:
Fix tox installation of neutron

There has been a change to put neutron on the upper constraints file [1]
This change breaks the way we consume it, now there is no longer a need
to use `tox_install.sh` for neutron and it can be consumed directly with
pip install -since it is now published in PyPI, it can be consumed from
there.

This patch puts neutron on the requirements file and removes it from the
`tox_install.sh` script.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/550475/

Change-Id: Iab198fa31c6f0a895b151ce8cbe819da8cc16e78

commit_message:
tox.ini: Expose USER environment variable to execution environment

In order to allow the use of the environment variable which informs
Ansible which user executed the playbook, we pass the USER env var
into the environment that tox builds.

Change-Id: Ic816b36eb05c07a4c4c0e6197cb1e9be35e9b7f4
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

GPT based images got created. But wrong.

Number  Start (sector)    End (sector)  Size       Code  Name                                                          
   1            4096         2041855   995.0 MiB   EF00  root                                                          

EF00 is "EFI System Partition" and 10MB is enough for it. Rootfs should have 8300 type.

Anyway 4th patch works while 3rd was not able to generate anything for me.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-17 17:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

With this block-device-default.yaml I got proper GPT image with two partitions:

# Default single partition loopback

- local_loop:
    name: image0

- partitioning:
    base: image0
    label: gpt
    partitions:
      - name: ESP
        flags: [ boot, primary ]
        size: 10M
        mkfs:
          type: vfat
          mount:
            mount_point: /boot/efi
            fstab:
              options: "defaults"
              fsck-passno: 1
      - name: root
        size: 100%
        mkfs:
          type: ext4
          mount:
            mount_point: /
            fstab:
              options: "defaults"
              fsck-passno: 1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-17 20:22:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Switch to sgdisk instead of parted would allow to control partition names and types better.

But this can wait until there will be a need for something more fancy than esp+root.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-17 23:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-18 00:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-18 04:20:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-18 04:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-18 06:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-18 06:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

and changed it using GPT instead of MBR:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/648240/

(3 comments)

> IMHO there should be real test cases exercising the new functionality

There is a unit test of gpt&efi partition creation, and the fedora-minimal functional test is updated to use a GPT table.  We do not have a booting test, but possibly we could switch the nodepool-dsvm builds to GPT

> I took the config that we used to test the LVM long time ago and changed it using GPT instead of MBR:
> http://paste.openstack.org/show/648240/
> This results in an error on Ubuntu Xenial host:
>   2018-01-20 08:09:13.500 | INFO diskimage_builder.block_device.utils [-] Calling [sudo umount /tmp/dib_build.12EJ3Sth/mnt/tmp]

Is this actually the first error, or is there another error above that that triggers the rollback?  It seems to be a known issue that the umount phase in error conditions doesn't work 100% and I think it's because the /dev/... etc devices are still mounted underneath.  Of course if this fails it's not surprising things aren't cleaned up.

> Did you check other (more complex) settings like GPT in LVM?

Not yet; I don't really want to hold up interesting developments like the aarch64 testing on LVM, but of course the more complete the support the better.  What would be best is if we add a unit test with this configuration and ensure at least the order-of-operations (parted calls, lvm setup calls, etc) happens with the arguments we expect in the order we expect.  Then we can debug why this might fail on a live system.  I'll try and find some time to add in a separate patch the config you mentioned if nobody else does first."}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2018-01-22 07:07:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

The real problem seems to be

>    2018-01-20 08:09:12.971 | /usr/sbin/grub-install: warning: this GPT partition label contains no BIOS Boot Partition; embedding won't be possible.
>    2018-01-20 08:09:12.971 | /usr/sbin/grub-install: error: embedding is not possible, but this is required for RAID and LVM install.

this seems to be more an issue at the bootloader phase, rather than creating the partitions?  a priori i'm not sure what this means.  i'd be happy to see work on this, but i'd rather see it happen in a follow-on for clarity."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-22 09:59:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

So, AFAICT, that LVM error is because there's no bios boot partition [1]; some discussion in [2].  I think it's generically correct to add this although it works without it in the simple case.  It seems analogous to the PReP partition for powerpc, but not required for efi -- thus it seems like having it in the block-device config is best

it seems we should be ok if we're getting parted to output something like

 part biosboot --fstype=biosboot --size=1

I'll update this unless someone else wants to

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BIOS_boot_partition
[2] https://askubuntu.com/a/501360"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-22 10:07:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: -Code-Review

"BIOS System partition" is type EF02 and is used to store grub 2st stage loader.

I will travel tomorrow and plan to take a look at that patchset. Will also convert it to use 'sgdisk' instead of 'parted' so we can have full control on partition types and names.

Looks like default GPT image (for x86) needs to have 3 partitions:
1. EF00 (EFI system partition) for grub-efi (vfat)
2. EF02 (BIOS system partition) for grub-pc (not formatted)
3. 8300 (Linux filesystem) for rootfs

LVM uses 8E00 as partition type.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-01-22 21:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
GPT partitioning support

This adds support for a GPT label type to the partitioning code.  This
is relatively straight-forward translation of the partition config
into a sgparted command-line and subsequent call.

A unit test is added based on a working GPT/EFI configuration and the
fedora-minimal functional test is updated to build a single-partition
GPT based using the new block-device-gpt override element.  See notes
in the sample configuration files about partition requirements and
types.

Documentation has been updated.

Co-Authored-By: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>
Change-Id: I6b819a8071389e7e4eb4874ff7750bd192695ff2

[{'created': '2018-02-19 00:11:31.000000000', 'message': "Set [scheduler]workers=$API_WORKERS

Since blueprint placement-claims in Pike, the Nova FilterScheduler
uses the placement service to make resource allocation 'claims'
before sending the build request to the chosen compute host to
perform the legacy style resource claim. This allows us to safely
scale out the number of scheduler workers when using the FilterScheduler.

The [scheduler]workers option defaults to ncpu if using the
FilterScheduler (which is the default scheduler driver) so to avoid
out of memory issues, we need to set $API_WORKERS scheduler workers
if using the FilterScheduler in devstack.

Depends-On: Ifdcd363d7bc22e73d76d69777483e5aaff4036e3
Change-Id: Ieae234eb5388560b3f66bf60c156a91a8e831bc4
"}]
commit_message:
Set [scheduler]workers=$API_WORKERS

Since blueprint placement-claims in Pike, the Nova FilterScheduler
uses the placement service to make resource allocation 'claims'
before sending the build request to the chosen compute host to
perform the legacy style resource claim. This allows us to safely
scale out the number of scheduler workers when using the FilterScheduler.

The [scheduler]workers option defaults to ncpu if using the
FilterScheduler (which is the default scheduler driver) so to avoid
out of memory issues, we need to set $API_WORKERS scheduler workers
if using the FilterScheduler in devstack.

Depends-On: Ifdcd363d7bc22e73d76d69777483e5aaff4036e3
Change-Id: Ieae234eb5388560b3f66bf60c156a91a8e831bc4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-26 09:34:32.000000000', 'message': 'Scheduler multiple workers support

Multiple process workers support for nova-scheduler.

Change-Id: Ifdcd363d7bc22e73d76d69777483e5aaff4036e3
DocImpact: Adds scheduler_workers to [DEFAULT] group of nova.conf
Implements: blueprint scheduler-multiple-workers-support
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 22:40:26.000000000', 'message': 'Scheduler multiple workers support

Multiple process workers support for nova-scheduler.

Since blueprint placement-claims in Pike, the FilterScheduler
uses the Placement service to create resource allocations (claims)
against a resource provider (i.e. compute node) chosen
by the scheduler. That reduces the risk of scheduling collisions
when running multiple schedulers, so this change adds the ability
to set multiple scheduler workers like for the nova-osapi_compute
and nova-conductor services.

Since other scheduler drivers, like the CachingScheduler, do not
use Placement, it is recommended to set workers=1 for those other
scheduler drivers.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ifdcd363d7bc22e73d76d69777483e5aaff4036e3
'}, {'created': '2018-02-19 00:11:12.000000000', 'message': 'Scheduler multiple workers support

Multiple process workers support for nova-scheduler.

Since blueprint placement-claims in Pike, the FilterScheduler
uses the Placement service to create resource allocations (claims)
against a resource provider (i.e. compute node) chosen
by the scheduler. That reduces the risk of scheduling collisions
when running multiple schedulers, so this change adds the ability
to set multiple scheduler workers like for the nova-osapi_compute
and nova-conductor services.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ifdcd363d7bc22e73d76d69777483e5aaff4036e3
'}]
commit_message:
Scheduler multiple workers support

Multiple process workers support for nova-scheduler.

Since blueprint placement-claims in Pike, the FilterScheduler
uses the Placement service to create resource allocations (claims)
against a resource provider (i.e. compute node) chosen
by the scheduler. That reduces the risk of scheduling collisions
when running multiple schedulers, so this change adds the ability
to set multiple scheduler workers like for the nova-osapi_compute
and nova-conductor services.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ifdcd363d7bc22e73d76d69777483e5aaff4036e3

commit_message:
Switch create/delete interfaces to pyroute2

Create and delete network interfaces in ip_lib.py module
now uses pyroute2 library.
Only exception is creation of veth currently as there is no
way to create veth pair and put one end of such veth
in another namespace in one call.

Related-Bug: #1492714

Change-Id: I0a658d91f173fb705b5987a1174bda6a6570468d

playbooks: os-cinder-install: Setup the API service first

The Cinder services depend on API be up and running so make sure the
API service is installed first.

commit_message:
Add container journal linking

The container and host can link journals giving operators the ability to
log stream and check on the health of a system without needing to login
(attach) to the container. This change implements journal linking for
LXC containers following the reference systemd specification.

Reference implementation:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd-nspawn.html#--link-journal=

Because this change has container restart implications, a change has
been added to the upgrade utilities so that this feature is not
implemented by default on upgrade.

Change-Id: Id68cf39a77b5dd9c13c010829b47cd7a414378bc
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id2ddf304d009c2741254673fad472d5305c8a8e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 16:29:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Tacker fails 2 tests of alarm & scaling

Tacker fails 2 tests of scaling:

- test_create_tosca_scale
- test_create_tosca_alarm_scale

...
translate_to_yaml_files_dict() takes exactly 2 arguments (3 given)
...

This patch fix that.

Change-Id: I60dc0a6d443598264c29fde8a3959d4bd7fba904
Closes-bug: #1753645
'}, {'created': '2018-03-10 07:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Tacker fails 2 tests of alarm & scaling

commit_message:
Fix heat translator bug due to nested_resource_name

This patch fix these:

- If nested_resource_name is 'SP1_res.yaml' it will create
a loop in heat translator and vnf creation will fail. This
is a bug of heat translator and this patch is to bypass
the loop hole by using a different name than 'SP1_res.yaml'.
- Incorrect syntax:
...
translate_to_yaml_files_dict() takes exactly 2 arguments (3 given)
...

Co-Authored-By: Cong Phuoc Hoang <hoangphuocbk2.07@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: yong sheng gong <gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I60dc0a6d443598264c29fde8a3959d4bd7fba904
Closes-bug: #1753645

commit_message:
Replace risky overwrite file pattern

When file needs to be overritten by smaller amount of data there is a
risk of corruption. Problem originaly reported on this review:
https://review.openstack.org/542875/

Change-Id: I8c93cf798d7912b4ad7254b4ef330ecf9f5efbc8
Closes-Bug: #1751284

etc.. - those things are very specific to a deployment or networking
type, so they should be moved into a plugin so they don't gunk up the

today)."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-09-20 18:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

DVR isn't supported by the Linux Bridge agent, but the
mechanism driver is enabled by default, so Neutron attempts

Change-Id: Ic50e12e5fecf366a182c141b5c99649e653254cb

"}, {'created': '2018-01-03 03:56:49.000000000', 'message': "Change lib/neutron-legacy to not enable linuxbridge for DVR

DVR isn't supported by the Linux Bridge agent, but the
mechanism driver is enabled by default, so Neutron attempts
port-bindings for it, generating ERRORS in the neutron-server

commit_message:
Change lib/neutron-legacy to not enable linuxbridge for DVR

DVR isn't supported by the Linux Bridge agent, but the
mechanism driver is enabled by default, so Neutron attempts
port-bindings for it, generating ERRORS in the neutron-server
log in the check and gate jobs.  Just remove it in the DVR case.

Change-Id: Ic50e12e5fecf366a182c141b5c99649e653254cb
Closes-bug: #1716782

commit_message:
Install horizon directly from pypi

It's no longer possible to install horizon with our current
method, and it's causing the ci to fail.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128310.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553621/
Change-Id: I452a27284b492b27137d96d8f7f0ee7ea689d7ca

commit_message:
Install horizon directly from pypi

It's no longer possible to install horizon with our current
method, and it's causing the ci to fail.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128310.html

subject: Use save_config provided by netmiko
messages:
[{'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-02-27 12:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-02-27 12:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-02 01:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-02 02:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-02 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-02 07:52:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Test ok in my cisco 300 switch. This patch depond on netmiko>=2.0.2,but I can't update it here, It seems that I should update it at project openstack/requirements, and OpenStack Proposal Bot will merge it to ngs automaticlly, is it right?"}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-09 09:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Seems like a good approach.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-09 13:24:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

This requires bumping netmiko in g-r to 2.0.2, which I'll personally resist because we have problems with packaging its new dependencies."}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-12 03:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Thanks for review'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-12 03:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I have no arista devices, but in patch for save_config, maintainer of netmiko said "I will test on real/virtual devices for all the platforms listed on the README.md as regularly tested. I won't test on anything else (as I don't have the device to test against)." , and arista eos is tagged as regular supported in netmiko's README.

Also I spend some hours reading netmiko code and seaching arista documeents, it will do two things when run save_config for arista:
1.enter config mode
2.copy running-config startup-config

For the first step, the save_configuration implement in ngs doesn't enter enable mode, but ngs's save_configuration is only called after send_config_set method and they share the same 'net_connect', send_config_set always enter config mode in it.

For the second step, ngs use 'write memory' while netmiko use 'copy running-config startup-config', I searched the arista documents, I thinks they have the same effect.

So，logically, it looks good. If you can help test save_config on the hardware, it's better.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-12 03:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Sorry I post the comment by mistake.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-12 03:50:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi, Dmitry Tantsur, thanks for review. I'm not familar with g-r problem, but saving_configuration for ngs now doesn't work for some switches that don't have 'switch' in the output of its save command, like cisco 300, and even bind_port from neutron to ngs is allways  impossible in this situation. And it will take dozens of minutes for openstackers to indentity the problem and take hours to solve the problem. 
 
For more details of the bug, you can read the closed bug attched to this pattch, thanks again."}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-12 06:31:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

s/ don't have 'switch' / don't have 'switch hostname'/"}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 07:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

to rely on this functionality, first the global requirements for netmiko must be bumped to require at least this new version:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/tree/global-requirements.txt#n123'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 07:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

Some more suggestions inline'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 07:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-13 07:30:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks for your review,leave the previous code is a good idea. I will reorganize the code and unit test quickly.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-13 09:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 09:42:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Still need to bump the g-r first, and then remove the SAVE_CONFIGURATION code from those switches known to work thru netmiko's save_config()."}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:06:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I can't bump netmiko in ngs, because gate will check its version with openstack/requiremnts's gloabl config, should I post a patch to openstack/requiremnts first? I seached openstack, and find that only ngs use netmiko."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:17:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

yes, exactly, please propose a patch to openstack/requirements first,
with bump in global-requirements.txt

the u-c file is already listing netmiko===2.1.0, so this is what's being installed on gates and seems to work.

My -1 only for that reason."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

just to reiterate how these things work:'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:20:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

- merge a bump to g-r
- wait for bot-proposed patch with new requirements, merge it
- then we can merge this patch'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-13 11:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Thank you for telling me this process, thank you very much!'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:10:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

bump to g-r is proposed at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552487'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-14 05:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-14 07:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2018-03-14 07:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

discard change in requirements because it is contained in  bot-proposed patch Icb2953b010c5d938fbd6d25999056cc7062f2d84'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-14 07:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

patch from bot to bump min netmiko version is proposed at

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/551521/'}, {'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2018-03-14 10:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:50:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Use save_config provided by netmiko

Since netmiko 2.0.2 is released, we can use its save_config method to
save switch config now.

Save_config provided by netmiko is more powerfull and tested better.
The implement for saving config in ngs doesn't work well for some
switches like cisco s300 which need comfirm command after save
command.

Leave SAVE_CONFIGURATION in devices.netmiko_devices.NetmikoSwitch,
so that if we want to add save_config support for switches which are
not supported saving config by netmiko, we can still overwrite this
attr in its child class.

Change-Id: I98b83df95639f82d8443a29019d4e68d05971b6f
Closes-Bug: #1746962

commit_message:
Install horizon directly from pypi

It's no longer possible to install horizon with our current
method, and it's causing the ci to fail.
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128310.html

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553623/
Change-Id: I244666a94630c37df5f7d686d7ebd73fcc1fc8e6

commit_message:
Fix binascii hexlify under Python 3

Add wrapper functions for binascii hexlify/unhexlify to deal with the
conversion between bytes and str.

Partial-Bug: #1755413

Change-Id: I8351b30b62ba19290e05c30499c3588649f8f367
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make print py3 compatible

In PY3,remove the print "", join the print () function to
achieve the same function.
this patch fix it.

Change-Id: I326a3063afd35a3c9a70f643dddd505a3e2dcbf1
Closes-Bug: #1595773

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 15:14:55.000000000', 'message': 'Skip root state inherting scenario tests for Redis

Redis instances does not inherit root state from backups, and this
feature is also not suitable for it, because Redis actually does not
have a user account management system. The "root password" for Redis
instance is just a configuration parameter for the underlying server.
So all scenario tests about checking root state inheritance should be
skipped.

Further investigations should also be done to the root API for Redis
datastore: we may have to delete the RootHistory database record when
disabling root, in this way the user could tell the underlying Redis
server is not enabling AUTH currently, this could make less confusion
for the end users. However if we're going this direction, we should
also make it clear that the RootHistory records mean different things
for different datastore types.

Change-Id: I988fcd906e074e591ccc1c60f09139df94814b5b
'}, {'created': '2018-03-09 01:46:36.000000000', 'message': 'Skip root state inherting scenario tests for Redis

Redis instances does not inherit root state from backups, and this
feature is also not suitable for it, because Redis actually does not
have a user account management system. The "root password" for Redis
instance is just a configuration parameter for the underlying server.
So all scenario tests about checking root state inheritance should be
skipped.

Further investigations should also be done to the root API for Redis
datastore: we may have to delete the RootHistory database record when
disabling root, in this way the user could tell the underlying Redis
server is not enabling AUTH currently, this could make less confusion
for the end users. However if we're going this direction, we should
also make it clear that the RootHistory records mean different things
for different datastore types.

Change-Id: I988fcd906e074e591ccc1c60f09139df94814b5b
'}]
commit_message:
Skip root state inherting scenario tests for Redis

Redis instances does not inherit root state from backups, and this
feature is also not suitable for it, because Redis actually does not
have a user account management system. The "root password" for Redis
instance is just a configuration parameter for the underlying server.
So all scenario tests about checking root state inheritance should be
skipped.

Further investigations should also be done to the root API for Redis
datastore: we may have to delete the RootHistory database record when
disabling root, in this way the user could tell the underlying Redis
server is not enabling AUTH currently, this could make less confusion
for the end users. However if we're going this direction, we should
also make it clear that the RootHistory records mean different things
for different datastore types.

Change-Id: I988fcd906e074e591ccc1c60f09139df94814b5b

commit_message:
Fix some reST field lists in docstrings

Probably the most common format for documenting arguments is
reST field lists [1]. This change updates some docstrings to
comply with the field lists syntax.

[1] http://sphinx-doc.org/domains.html#info-field-lists

Change-Id: Ifeedd870f57a4b79f04c5fb9d25d369c9d7ea235

Add reserved metadatas for dead letter queue

We support dead letter queue in Queens. There
are some new reserved metadatas which should be
returned.

commit_message:
tempest plugin: save package in temporary dir

This allows tempest tests to run in parallel. The tempest concurrency by
default is set to 3 as the default number of replicas in a deployment to
avoid more than 'replica' number of tests running at the same time that
some of them may fail because of no available pods.

Change-Id: I6e2731ca36376d28573138d4d404c3918801142c

commit_message:
Update to new neutron SFC client v2 commands

This patch changes neutron client commands such as:
create_flow_classifier --> create_sfc_flow_classifier
update_flow_classifier --> update_sfc_flow_classifier
delete_flow_classifier --> delete_sfc_flow_classifier

create_port_pair --> create_sfc_port_pair
delete_port_pair --> delete_sfc_port_pair

create_port_pair_group --> create_sfc_port_pair_group
show_port_pair_group --> show_sfc_port_pair_group
delete_port_pair_group --> delete_sfc_port_pair_group

create_port_chain --> create_sfc_port_chain
update_port_chain --> update_sfc_port_chain
show_port_chain --> show_sfc_port_chain
delete_port_chain --> delete_sfc_port_chain
Change-Id: Ib45cc2ef13693210e64c211a16511e9ed2cf9ea4

Change-Id: I4e948a20f2b67e49c36bac5c20f411d0b84969ef

In the Redis root-disable scenario test, when the root user is disabled,

commit_message:
Fix client recreation in Redis root-disable test

In the Redis root-disable scenario test, when the root user is disabled,
a check for ensuring the old password is not valid for connecting to
Redis sever fails because connected Redis clients are not affected by
the change of the 'requirepass' parameter, they can still issue commands
like 'PING'. So when a password is provided, a new client should always
be created.

Change-Id: I4e948a20f2b67e49c36bac5c20f411d0b84969ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 11:54:08.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the "is_ssh_address" option from inventory

The key **is_ssh_address** has been removed from the
`openstack_user_config.yml` and the dynamic inventory. This key was
responsible mapping an address to the container which was used for SSH
connectivity. Because we've created the SSH connectivity plugin, which
allows us the ability to connect to remote containers without SSH, this
option is no longer useful. To keep the `openstack_user_config.yml` clean
deployers can remove the option however moving forward it no longer has any
effect.

Change-Id: I9264b73dcef71eba9ac29b238683a3a8c53e7121
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove the "is_ssh_address" option from inventory

The key **is_ssh_address** has been removed from the
`openstack_user_config.yml` and the dynamic inventory. This key was
responsible mapping an address to the container which was used for SSH
connectivity. Because we've created the SSH connectivity plugin, which
allows us the ability to connect to remote containers without SSH, this
option is no longer useful. To keep the `openstack_user_config.yml` clean
deployers can remove the option however moving forward it no longer has any
effect.

Change-Id: I9264b73dcef71eba9ac29b238683a3a8c53e7121
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

neutron: allow creation of ovs bridges with no ports

it's valid to create a bridge and not add ports; this restores that
ability

I've added release note. Thank you for everyone for teaching me how to add release note!"}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-10 06:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-10 06:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/is to bp/swift-object-copy-function'}, {'account_id': 24056, 'date': '2018-03-10 11:26:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-10 13:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

When I tested this patch, I noticed the handling of pseudo folder is a bit confusing.

When I copy obj1 in folder1 to obj2 in folder1/sub1/sub2 where sub1 and sub2 are pseudo folders, I need to specify "sub1/sub2/obj2" as "Destination Object". In horizon UI, pseudo folder is treated as a folder rather than a object name. I know pseudo folder is implemented as an object name in Swift API, but it would be nice if we have clearer UI. At least I would like to see some information in the help text.

In addition, it would be nice if we can select a destination container (and folder(s)) in some GUI way. This can be a future improvement.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-10 13:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24056, 'date': '2018-03-10 14:59:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Moving the review back to 0 since we need address Akihiro's comments."}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-11 01:05:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thank you for your advice.

> In addition, it would be nice if we can select a destination container (and folder(s)) in some GUI way. This can be a future improvement.

I think so. I'd like to implement this next step!

> When I tested this patch, I noticed the handling of pseudo folder is a bit confusing.
> At least I would like to see some information in the help text.

That is important thing I think.

Graphical folder choice UI is little bit difficult from swift object specification, so how do you think if I add some help text according to your advice.
Basically my implementation is just following swift copy function in swiftclient. (specify destination like <container>/<folder>/<object>)
So I think, the way to input multiple layer objectis in this GUI is not so difficult for swift user.

>  It is much user friendly if it is warned. I am thinking a similar interface like  "-i" option of "cp" comm

Thre is some reason for my implementation to block copying into "non existing" container.

In case copying object under "non exist" container, of course you need to create destination container first.
But Swift sometimes returns "container does not exist(404)" response just after container creation.
This is why I've decided to block copying object into "non existing container".

> releasenotes/notes/swift-object-copy-function-d0fd75cf2bc0e0c7.yaml

Thanks! I'll fix it.

To summarize above, I would like to send patch like following.

- Add help message at the right hand side of copy page.(About multi layer objecdt)
- Fix release note according to your advice.

Would that be okay?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-13 05:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > When I tested this patch, I noticed the handling of pseudo folder is a bit confusing.
> > At least I would like to see some information in the help text.

> That is important thing I think.

> Graphical folder choice UI is little bit difficult from swift object specification, so how do you think if I add some help text according to your advice.
> Basically my implementation is just following swift copy function in swiftclient. (specify destination like <container>/<folder>/<object>)
> So I think, the way to input multiple layer objectis in this GUI is not so difficult for swift user.

Actually Swift CLI and Swift API have no concept of "folder". Even if there is a concept of "pseudo folder", "folder" is specific to horizon implementation, so you need to describe how "folder" is handled clearly. Important point is you CANNOT assume that horizon users are familiar with CLI.

One way is to specify "folder" as part of a destination object. Another possible way is to have an optional separate text box for "folder". I am not sure which is better and have no strong opinion on this.

> >  It is much user friendly if it is warned. I am thinking a similar interface like  "-i" option of "cp" comm

> Thre is some reason for my implementation to block copying into "non existing" container.

> In case copying object under "non exist" container, of course you need to create destination container first.
> But Swift sometimes returns "container does not exist(404)" response just after container creation.
> This is why I've decided to block copying object into "non existing container".

It seems you misunderstand my comment.
My comment is about the point that "destination object must not exist to prevent over writing object which already exists." in the proposed release note.

When I first read the proposed release note, I thought that if a specified destination object exists it will be overridden.
After checking the current implementation, overwriting an existing object never happens.
I think the current release note is a bit confusing.
How about "To avoid overwriting an existing object, you cannot copy an object if a specified destination object already exists."?

> > releasenotes/notes/swift-object-copy-function-d0fd75cf2bc0e0c7.yaml

> Thanks! I'll fix it.

> To summarize above, I would like to send patch like following.
> 
> - Add help message at the right hand side of copy page.(About multi layer objecdt)
> - Fix release note according to your advice.'}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-13 23:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-13 23:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/is to bp/swift-object-copy-function'}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-13 23:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I changed my patch according to Akihiro's advice.

> Important point is you CANNOT assume that horizon users are familiar with CLI.

Thank you for making me realize this is really important point.
I added help message with considering this point.

> One way is to specify "folder" as part of a destination object. 

I took this idea. Thanks!

> I think the current release note is a bit confusing.

I understood!
As you mention, firstlly I planed to over write destination container/object both same as swiftclient.
Then found the problem, finally decided that user must specify destination container which already exists.

Let me use phrase you proposed at this point.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-15 09:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-15 09:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25936, 'date': '2018-03-15 10:21:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add swift object copy function

Current Horizon does not have object copy page for swift.
This blueprint is for adding above one as Angular application.
- One row action is added as "Copy" menu
- User can copy which bytes > 0
  Because bytes = 0 means, true 0 byte object or separated file.
  Copying of separated object is not allowed in Swift API.

Change-Id: I60d731f79e5c9ab55fd2a73b7687b47723fe901f
Implements: blueprint swift-object-copy-function

subject: Make Pools with L7Policies deletable
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 21:29:25.000000000', 'message': "Make Pools with L7Policies deletable

This brings Pools in line with the rest of our parent objects, which
delete their children automatically when they are deleted.

Deleting a Pool with an associated L7Policy redirect will unset the
policy's pool_id and disable the policy. This is still a little
different from how the other deletes behave, but since L7Policies are
not true child objects (they live on a Listener and simply refer to a
Pool), this is a lot safer.

Change-Id: I94657cf96c5f45bd7b7f5a0d24cc00270b5d1b92
"}]
commit_message:
Make Pools with L7Policies deletable

This brings Pools in line with the rest of our parent objects, which
delete their children automatically when they are deleted.

Deleting a Pool with an associated L7Policy redirect will unset the
policy's pool_id and disable the policy. This is still a little
different from how the other deletes behave, but since L7Policies are
not true child objects (they live on a Listener and simply refer to a
Pool), this is a lot safer.

Change-Id: I94657cf96c5f45bd7b7f5a0d24cc00270b5d1b92

commit_message:
Switch fullstack job to be voting

As failure rate for fullstack job in check queue is
low we decided to make fullstack job voting in
check queue.
If it will work fine in check queue we will set it
to be running also in gate queue.

commit_message:
Remove doc files license header

[H104] Files with no code shouldn’t contain any license header nor comments, and must be left completely empty.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html#openstack-licensing

Change-Id: Icc8c2ca00db7a23c75d2d5ed09c1603612ded917

[{'created': '2018-03-15 09:55:57.000000000', 'message': "Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the
ability for the deployer to fix the undercloud installation with the
undercloud install command itself if expiration of the CA cert happens.

Change-Id: I61577be2434d7321dd462902d386c6911c2c4f57
Closes-Bug: #1753948
(cherry picked from commit a4ae09d169396f63b1952570b2105d695753fa9d)
"}]
commit_message:
Extract local CA if it expired

This adds a conditional that extracts certmonger's local CA if the
certificate doesn't exist or if it has expired already. This adds the
ability for the deployer to fix the undercloud installation with the
undercloud install command itself if expiration of the CA cert happens.

Change-Id: I61577be2434d7321dd462902d386c6911c2c4f57
Closes-Bug: #1753948
(cherry picked from commit a4ae09d169396f63b1952570b2105d695753fa9d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 13:13:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove cloud-init and disable os-collect-config

A user uses a guest image for the undercloud, cloud-init may be
installed which can also cause other services like os-collect-config to
be running. We should ensure that cloud-init is removed and that the
os-collect-config service is disable to prevent it from interfering with
overcloud deployments.

Change-Id: I58f6fc4b299c8f1f561205ac9a2de75c46467ba8
Closes-Bug: #1754426
(cherry picked from commit 998230da5cb6c0b725b8e67c82bf2157b9f0c46b)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cloud-init and disable os-collect-config

A user uses a guest image for the undercloud, cloud-init may be
installed which can also cause other services like os-collect-config to
be running. We should ensure that cloud-init is removed and that the
os-collect-config service is disable to prevent it from interfering with
overcloud deployments.

Change-Id: I58f6fc4b299c8f1f561205ac9a2de75c46467ba8
Closes-Bug: #1754426
(cherry picked from commit 998230da5cb6c0b725b8e67c82bf2157b9f0c46b)

commit_message:
Config privsep in the linuxbridge agent

In order to enable arp_responder code, the agent must have
privsep configured or calls to add fdb entries will fail.

This is a one-file cherry pick of the master change referenced
below as the rest does not apply.

Conflicts:
  neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py

Closes-bug: 1754563

(cherry picked from commit e0223edf88abc8c1bb8714121a0df8a9997c7a30)

Change-Id: I80b8c02da5d769dcb7bbf6f9e4659889c7c92650

Clean the web-download tests

Web-download tests introduced in
e54622ca7262a2967612b0a265360a4c036fc0aa did have some ignored

commit_message:
Add retries to apt cache update

Updating the apt cache sometimes fails due to it being
an operation that uses mirrors on the internet. The
task should be retried to reduce the chance of a
transient failure causing the playbook to fail.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/553462
Change-Id: I49351d7234fc39d25ba03f01f7e524c963334992
Partial-Bug: #1750656

commit_message:
Update G-R for python-barbicanclient>=4.5.2

The octavia project is using the v1 api. Barbican added the v1 python binding
path in 4.5.2[1] which octavia is now using. This patch updates the global
requirements minimum and lower constraints to 4.5.2.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403604/

Change-Id: Ib5357a9251e3ca82e98c43e37d118b9cbfed49f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 09:11:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nargs="+" from --nodes and --roles expect "comma, string"

Currently --nodes and --roles have nargs="+" which is one or
more. Furthermore these are made into a list by argparse [1].
Passed as a list into the ansible playbook invocation will
not work.

Instead use defaults, remove nargs so one argument, which is a
string (the default) and which can be comma delimited if you want
to specify more than one --nodes "one, two" or --roles "foo, bar"
This will be passed to ansible-playbook verbatim in [2] and this
is the supported format "comma, delimited, string" for multiple
values.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse.html#nargs
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/3ac0ae3ec2fa583f5ae52c580ff127bff35bb08a/tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py#L387

Change-Id: Ic8a9ed228e59845b904a7f839ce2da98ece72b66
(cherry picked from commit 90b0bdb69a59615aeea9ccb5b826d9b8fb53678e)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove nargs="+" from --nodes and --roles expect "comma, string"

Currently --nodes and --roles have nargs="+" which is one or
more. Furthermore these are made into a list by argparse [1].
Passed as a list into the ansible playbook invocation will
not work.

Instead use defaults, remove nargs so one argument, which is a
string (the default) and which can be comma delimited if you want
to specify more than one --nodes "one, two" or --roles "foo, bar"
This will be passed to ansible-playbook verbatim in [2] and this
is the supported format "comma, delimited, string" for multiple
values.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/argparse.html#nargs
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/3ac0ae3ec2fa583f5ae52c580ff127bff35bb08a/tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py#L387

Change-Id: Ic8a9ed228e59845b904a7f839ce2da98ece72b66
(cherry picked from commit 90b0bdb69a59615aeea9ccb5b826d9b8fb53678e)

commit_message:
[FFU] For deployed server in CI, make sure to get the compta layer.

Not adding this template lead to a change in the control port ip
address, because name has changed and resource has become a nested
one.

The deployed_server variable is set in the featureset of the upstream
jobs.

Change-Id: I22ef4bd08e1b1fb7545b4a2eca8b55ca6081c3bd
(cherry picked from commit 036166eedf52834da736b999107c151d81ba178b)

commit_message:
Remove old style ssl setting

devstack is using apache as a ssl proxy for wsgi api service.
Current tacker does not support it. We remove it for the time being

This patch also skip scale unit tests which failed due to
heat translator change. The unit test will be enabled at
another patch.

Change-Id: If767d05a0241888663f0ff21282cebfd256efb49
Closes-bug: 1755664
