reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-17 16:26:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-17 16:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-17 18:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-17 18:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-17 18:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-10-25 20:19:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The proper way to do this is to use an actual KSA plugin that does the right thing rather than hack around trying to avoid plugins.  The --os-endpoint option is declared in KSA's admin_token plugin which is actually rarely used so you can not depend on that option being available from that source.

I think the proper approach would be to use KSA's NoAuth plugin, or a subclass of it that defines the option that you want to get the service endpoint from (it could be --os-endpoint or --os-url if that doesn't confuse users.

This really should be done in KSA itself, Jamie still gives me grief about defining the TokenEndpoint plugin in OSC.  Putting it in KSA will make it available to all libs/apps that consume it.  If it can't go there for some reason, putting it here should look a lot like the openstackclient.api.auth_plugin that has the TokenEndpoint class, but in osc-lib."}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-27 14:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-27 14:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-27 15:00:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-27 15:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-27 15:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-10-27 15:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Allow to use the none auth plugin

This change allows to use the none auth plugin in CLI without having
to specify --os-cloud file with basically a single endpoint parameter.

Closes-Bug: #1724283
Depends-On: I3e477895ba0c989ffd0c91c45791e9f74173a3d6
Depends-On: I3de32193f41d9d1012043b43ae8080f3b1e828e5
Change-Id: I6cf4e22d676f4a55f84863125aee7318915a7404

commit_message:
Containerized undercloud: Set --local-domain from undercloud.conf

Currently --local-domain is left unset if we use the containerized
undercloud which prevents us from having the correct CloudDomain.
This uses the overcloud_domain_name parameter from undercloud.conf
to set that value.

Change-Id: I29cb82db7f1046d92d882724e6a4a99e4d5ac84a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 19:39:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix the assertion of standard error text

In the test 'test_run_unknown_command', we assert the exact matching
of stderr output stream but this will break if there are extra
output. An example is the deprecation warning outputted by any library
neutronclient depends on.

Change-Id: Ia80c13be5afd97ed1ada8ead70888971f0159647
Closes-Bug: #1755575
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the assertion of standard error text

In the test 'test_run_unknown_command', we assert the exact matching
of stderr output stream but this will break if there are extra
output. An example is the deprecation warning outputted by any library
neutronclient depends on.

Change-Id: Ia80c13be5afd97ed1ada8ead70888971f0159647
Closes-Bug: #1755575

commit_message:
Pass plan_name into get_config action

Without this the config defaults to "overcloud" even when a different
--stack argument is used

Change-Id: I24345a5b8a106ef0a166764a926159e109c4494e
Partial-Bug: #1755525
(cherry picked from commit c3c6724afe55c96fb3e8b140475fa6c17d54198c)

commit_message:
Ensure ceph-ansible playbooks are run one at a time

Previously if we passed a list of ceph-ansible playbooks to run
Mistral would trigger them in parallel.

Change-Id: Ia21f426d9c0961edd148c26fd6c22eb03c5bcf2f
(cherry picked from commit 94509832bfe3cc667cf3e89aebf4fa7b55b1d940)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 00:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'Log health manager exceptions

The executor will hide any unhandled exceptions raised from the update_health
or update_stats methods. This patch updates the health manager to log those
exceptions.

commit_message:
Log health manager exceptions

The executor will hide any unhandled exceptions raised from the update_health
or update_stats methods. This patch updates the health manager to log those
exceptions.

Change-Id: I941730c5e0964ec319b5eb2b7992335b71f9d134

commit_message:
tox.ini: Expose USER environment variable to execution environment

In order to allow the use of the environment variable which informs
Ansible which user executed the playbook, we pass the USER env var
into the environment that tox builds.

Change-Id: I74925105a4549f434ee44c4ac478d349fadc9f13
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Add release note on migration from vpn-agent to L3 agent extension

Unfortunately we have no release note on VPNaaS l3 agent extensions.
It is a big change from operator perspective, so it is worth documented
as a release note.

This commit is intentionally proposed directly to stable/queens
so that we can have this only in the queens release notes.

Change-Id: I61bec5d84ff554a9d39e11c58f9ed54787db36a3
Closes-Bug: #1751069

messages:
[{'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-03-13 13:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-03-13 14:04:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If I understand, we can only backport critical bugfixes and security patches [1]. I'm not sure if this is a feature or a bug fix. But I don't think it is a 'critical bug fix'.

I'm open to being convinced otherwise, but for now...

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#support-phases"}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-03-13 14:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed.

- hpe-gen9-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-ilo-virtual-media-direct http://15.184.0.52/15/552515/1/check/hpe-gen9-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-uefi-ilo-virtual-media-direct/abaf4e7/ : FAILURE in 10m 52s
- hpe-gen8-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-bios-ilo-virtual-media-iscsi http://15.184.0.52/15/552515/1/check/hpe-gen8-dsvm-ironic-standalone-wholedisk-bios-ilo-virtual-media-iscsi/c303eb6/ : SUCCESS in 29m 07s'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-03-13 14:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/15/552515/1/check/dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac/2ab1283/ : SUCCESS in 51m 31s
- dell-hw14G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/15/552515/1/check/dell-hw14G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-idrac/c96f3ea/ : SUCCESS in 51m 39s
- dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool https://stash.dellemc-community.org/logs/15/552515/1/check/dell-hw13G-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipmitool/ead1cf7/ : SUCCESS in 51m 55s'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-03-13 17:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ruby, one aspect that is related to "security" is that without this patch. Deployer are being forced to open up the Swift public VIP (to facilitate Swift tempURL) to the Ironic node in order to mount the virtual media where before (i.e. in Newton) we don't have to do that. This backward incompatible change is causing operational security folks headache.'}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-03-14 10:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Ruby, I want this backported as a base for fixing this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1755164
The master branch already has it fixed as a side effect of refactoring. I could make some dedicated fix for this bug without this backport but even the doc you linked requires that all backports are first merged to master and all branches in between. Note that this change is already present in queens.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-03-14 20:31:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I really see this as a feature because we're changing the overall usage pattern and introducing risk to deployments. I would like to understand why the security fix cannot be performed as a minimal impact change directly to the appropriate branches?"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-03-14 20:37:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree this should not be backported. It is a feature (per the bug being an RFE), and even if we could argue that it's a bugfix, it feels like a huge risky change to be backporting.

Note that the stable policy says: "The backport must match the master commit, unless there is a serious need to differ e.g gate failure, test framework changed in master, code refactoring or some other reason." In this case, it's probably okay to fix the issue directly on stable.

Which makes me wonder, what specifically do we need to fix the ilo tempurl thing? Just an endpoint override for swift? Or an option to select which catalog URL for swift we want to use?'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-03-14 23:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Julia, Jim, if understand your comments correctly, we *can* make a direct fix to stable/pike without using the backport mechanism? Please clarify.

Jim, yes, right now without this fix, Ironic always select the public endpoint. See

https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/common/swift.py#L138
https://github.com/openstack/python-swiftclient/blob/stable/pike/swiftclient/client.py#L647

Since we are only passing in the session, there's no way to override either the endpoint_type/interface or endpoint_url.

https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/stable/pike/ironic/common/swift.py#L57

Therefore, the only way to make it work is to open up network access to the Swift public endpoint. This is not the case in Newton release, where the Ironic nodes only need route to the internal endpoints. Not sure if I understand why this is consider an RFE. Are we saying this is by design since Ocata/Pike, that now deployer are *required* to create a route to the Swift public endpoint when using agent_ilo driver? Is this requirement documented?"}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-03-15 08:34:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Making a minimum fix for the bug we encounter should be even easier than backporting the bigger changes from master. Remaining question: assuming that the bug is a regression and before Pike the tempurls were generated using internal endpoint, should this fix have any configuration or just set the endpoint type to 'internal'?"}, {'account_id': 20312, 'date': '2018-03-15 11:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Closing in favor of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553330/'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-03-15 21:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@guang-yee:

Yes, we can fix directly on the branch, IMO. 

I meant that this patch being backported was for an RFE, not that fixing this bug on Pike would require an RFE.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-03-15 22:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Jim, understood. Thanks for the explanation.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-13 13:38:33.000000000', 'message': "Introduce keystoneauth adapters for clients

Currently ironic explicitly or implicitly sets the API urls
for most services in the config.
This is quite fragile and we should move to discovery from
the keystone catalog eventually.

To support this, this patch registers `keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter`
options to all config sections for service clients auth.
Among others it exports `interfaces` option that we set to
['internal', 'public'] by default.
Other exported options are `service_type`, `service_name`, `region_name`
and `endpoint_override`.
The latter will eventually be used by all clients to specify a specific
endpoint to use (for example in noauth mode).

Effectively this patch starts to move all clients code to load client
configuration from config for all of auth, session and adapter.

The first to move is [service_catalog] section, with [conductor]api_url
option being deprecated in favor of [service_catalog]endpoint_override.
A sane default of 'service_type' = 'baremetal' is set for this config
section as well.

More patches moving other clients to consume these new options and
deprecate some other options will follow.

Change-Id: I1283ef3b4d736ac089df0cc74a5850a93b24b6ab
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Partial-Bug: #1755164
Related-Bug: #1699542
(cherry picked from commit 308e414a57941675acf6cd825daafc653cf5927e)
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce keystoneauth adapters for clients

Currently ironic explicitly or implicitly sets the API urls
for most services in the config.
This is quite fragile and we should move to discovery from
the keystone catalog eventually.

To support this, this patch registers `keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter`
options to all config sections for service clients auth.
Among others it exports `interfaces` option that we set to
['internal', 'public'] by default.
Other exported options are `service_type`, `service_name`, `region_name`
and `endpoint_override`.
The latter will eventually be used by all clients to specify a specific
endpoint to use (for example in noauth mode).

Effectively this patch starts to move all clients code to load client
configuration from config for all of auth, session and adapter.

The first to move is [service_catalog] section, with [conductor]api_url
option being deprecated in favor of [service_catalog]endpoint_override.
A sane default of 'service_type' = 'baremetal' is set for this config
section as well.

More patches moving other clients to consume these new options and
deprecate some other options will follow.

Change-Id: I1283ef3b4d736ac089df0cc74a5850a93b24b6ab
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Partial-Bug: #1755164
Related-Bug: #1699542
(cherry picked from commit 308e414a57941675acf6cd825daafc653cf5927e)

This removes most of the upgrade steps... keeping the script
delivery but tempted to remove that too wdyt?

Should we also remove the env files? I think there is value in
setting the UpgradeInit/Common stuff? I made composable steps

first step of the upgrade) and update ansible here.

the operator should use

commit_message:
Remove the heat upgrade steps for Q upgrade workflow

This removes most of the Heat driver upgrade workflow, including
the script delivery and stepwise upgrade tasks with invocation
of ansible via heat

For Q upgrades the operator should use
    openstack overcloud upgrade --init-upgrade --container-registry-file file
    openstack overcloud upgrade --nodes Controller
etc.

Depends-On: I54f8fc57b758e34c620d607be15d2291d545ff6f
Change-Id: I75f087dc456c50327c3b4ad98a1f89a7e012dc68

Is this needed to get tests passing somewhere, tempest via the devstack plugin perhaps? With the defaults being enforced in code (like we do with configuration), are these references needed anymore?

I'm curious if there is a follow up to this -1 so that we can move things forward for tacker as far as the community goal is concerned.

commit_message:
Connect to default ports if none are specified

If the VNC is running at a default port and the address returned
is an address which does not contain a port, then the VNC tests
fail to connect because they attempt to call a socket connect
without an IP listed.

In addition, this makes sure that the Host header does not include
a port if we are hitting the default port so things are clean.

Change-Id: Ie5939a4c5789efb759f5a2372435be7f9af33e91

commit_message:
Update G-R for Werkzeug>=0.9

The octavia project is using the new HTTPException response parameter that is
only available in Werkzeug 0.9 or newer. Upper-constraints is already at
0.14.1 for this package.

Change-Id: I7d02e3eff17fdab11a9fd21080e2b9318d177c1c

Adding tests with non-same mac address for parent and sub ports.

parent port.

[{'created': '2018-03-15 16:53:09.000000000', 'message': 'Extending delete_cell --force to delete instance_mappings

Currently the nova-manage delete_cell command with the --force option
allows us to destroy hosts_mappings of the cell which does not have any
instances or instance_mappings. This patch extends this command with the
--force option for destroying instance_mappings in addition to the
host_mappings of the cell which is to be deleted. Note that the instance
mappings and host mappings are only removed if there are no living
instances in the cell. So a --force delete here will not work if there

Change-Id: Ibefa0465224bec9a22431c7d3b5c8f5d91fc7732

commit_message:
Extending delete_cell --force to delete instance_mappings

Currently the nova-manage delete_cell command with the --force option
allows us to destroy hosts_mappings of the cell which does not have any
instances or instance_mappings. This patch extends this command with the
--force option for destroying instance_mappings in addition to the
host_mappings of the cell which is to be deleted. Note that the instance
mappings and host mappings are only removed if there are no living
instances in the cell. So a --force delete here will not work if there
are non-deleted instances.

Change-Id: Ibefa0465224bec9a22431c7d3b5c8f5d91fc7732
Closes-Bug: #1745375
(cherry picked from commit ee2f65d91fb632f04be3572967029cd58be4c614)

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: Always remove readvertised route

Route are always removed from self.readvertised even if it isn't the last route
for the corresponding tracked_entry.

Also refactor some code to dissociate default route readvertised for
'attract_traffic' from others readvertisement.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>
Submitted on behalf of a third-party: Orange

Change-Id: Ic7f597e59a473a9fffd9459ac963ce300f79cf35
Closes-Bug: 1750859
(cherry picked from commit 4155e96ba469cb97f36b6778376088fec19de8e4)

commit_message:
Add documentation for the project history and guide lines

Because of how vague the scope of Adjutant is (for a reason)
we need a way to define what actually fits in a sensible way.
The new guide lines are part of that, and we're also now
adding a section to our docs about the project history to
explain why the scope is so vague and how it got there.
Plus a section on project features, to help define what it
can do.

Change-Id: I7d05c1f43570843171a4144ece2228efc3227cce

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: ensure instance id uniqueness

Fix a how instance ids are allocated, to ensure that
two VPN instance do not end up using the same id.

Yes, this is appalling.

Change-Id: I474834340751d05ae33b6eb8404511e23f110598
Closes-Bug: 1745145
(cherry picked from commit 3af0e228eaf0fcac4a8c741a4ad14c4d336b4d2b)

commit_message:
Add enable_masquerading parameter

Implement enable_masquerading parameter, disabled by default. If set to
True, we'll deploy the undercloud with environments/services/routed-networks.yaml
service, useful when deploying OVB for PoC or testing environments.

Change-Id: Ia6a5de214af8e6fd0e1a3faecbf23c350dd9d37c

subject: Fix bootstrap NAT
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 17:21:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix bootstrap NAT

Docker will switch the FORWARD filter to DROP if it sets the ip_forward
to 1. Previously we were doing this in a post configuration element
rather than in the puppet run itself. This change moves the ip_forward=1
to puppet so it runs prior to docker being installed. Additionally we
are ensuring that the full set of network rules are being added to the
FORWARD filter because previously we were only setting half of them.
This would allow us to actually not have to use ACCEPT as the default
for the FORWARD filter but this would require additional testing.

Conflicts:
	elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template
	elements/undercloud-install/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/98-undercloud-setup

Change-Id: Ieae6a74f7269bd64606fd80a2a08b2058c24d2c5
Closes-Bug: #1750194
Closes-Bug: #1750874
(cherry picked from commit bfb758b5e792c83e5cde9847bcad424fcfaf071d)
(cherry picked from commit 50217d7a93dce7fdc17c0dfbb04260f86fd3ac7d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bootstrap NAT

Docker will switch the FORWARD filter to DROP if it sets the ip_forward
to 1. Previously we were doing this in a post configuration element
rather than in the puppet run itself. This change moves the ip_forward=1
to puppet so it runs prior to docker being installed. Additionally we
are ensuring that the full set of network rules are being added to the
FORWARD filter because previously we were only setting half of them.
This would allow us to actually not have to use ACCEPT as the default
for the FORWARD filter but this would require additional testing.

Conflicts:
	elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template
	elements/undercloud-install/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/98-undercloud-setup

Change-Id: Ieae6a74f7269bd64606fd80a2a08b2058c24d2c5
Closes-Bug: #1750194
Closes-Bug: #1750874
(cherry picked from commit bfb758b5e792c83e5cde9847bcad424fcfaf071d)
(cherry picked from commit 50217d7a93dce7fdc17c0dfbb04260f86fd3ac7d)

subject: inventory: all: Switch package state to 'present' on openSUSE
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:07:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-14 20:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-03-15 09:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-03-15 14:38:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 16:07:40.000000000', 'message': "inventory: all: Switch package state to 'present' on openSUSE

Similar to the CentOS case, we should use 'present' instead of 'latest'
for the package state so we don't spend time resolving dependencies,
querying repos etc. The 'present' state can be further improved either
in the zypper itself or in the Ansible module.

Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/37191
Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1084525

Change-Id: I8a6598013714e468d19f4984288d2c746515b5ca
"}]
commit_message:
inventory: all: Switch package state to 'present' on openSUSE

Similar to the CentOS case, we should use 'present' instead of 'latest'
for the package state so we don't spend time resolving dependencies,
querying repos etc. The 'present' state can be further improved either
in the zypper itself or in the Ansible module.

Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/37191
Link: https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1084525

Change-Id: I8a6598013714e468d19f4984288d2c746515b5ca

subject: Include active nodes when matching nodes by profile
messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-03-14 19:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-03-15 13:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 19:37:44.000000000', 'message': "Include active nodes when matching nodes by profile

When matching nodes by profile, consider nodes in either the 'active'
or 'available' provisioning states. Unless nodes in the 'active' state
are included, the derived parameters workflow fails on stack updates.

Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I575d0c358b9efccdefddb26258839def43ebeafd
Closes-Bug: #1752893
(cherry picked from commit 4820e11d1eb38e6a81ced0c9af38dff8a46e097e)
(cherry picked from commit 8f93bfdf1f836d4f1f51a1a59c5b2938fe63cb8b)
"}]
commit_message:
Include active nodes when matching nodes by profile

When matching nodes by profile, consider nodes in either the 'active'
or 'available' provisioning states. Unless nodes in the 'active' state
are included, the derived parameters workflow fails on stack updates.

Co-Authored-By: Alan Bishop <abishop@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I575d0c358b9efccdefddb26258839def43ebeafd
Closes-Bug: #1752893
(cherry picked from commit 4820e11d1eb38e6a81ced0c9af38dff8a46e097e)
(cherry picked from commit 8f93bfdf1f836d4f1f51a1a59c5b2938fe63cb8b)

commit_message:
Refactor futurist calls

After futurist calls were introduced, the code became difficult to
understand. For example, local variables are used something like global.
To keep the code easier to understand, the usage of local variables
should be more scoped.

This commit introduces a wrapper function for futurist.ThreadPoolExecutor
and converts inline functions into normal methods.
I believe it improves the code readability a lot.

Change-Id: Id5b7a06c50e397c8c27447322d7f64f2d65c06b6

commit_message:
Add retries to apt cache update

Updating the apt cache sometimes fails due to it being
an operation that uses mirrors on the internet. The
task should be retried to reduce the chance of a
transient failure causing the playbook to fail.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/553462
Change-Id: Id564e84ee69093c781357d7f3c78dbf612e1d130
Partial-Bug: #1750656

commit_message:
Add retries to apt cache update

Updating the apt cache sometimes fails due to it being
an operation that uses mirrors on the internet. The
task should be retried to reduce the chance of a
transient failure causing the playbook to fail.

Change-Id: I55f45ea78adbc77f66b1ae7dc9d9de447201b5cb
Partial-Bug: #1750656

commit_message:
bagpipe ml2: agent extension, do not modify device_details on callbacks

Modifying the device details dictionnary on handle_port or delete_port
callbacks is something that has, of course, side effects... :-/

Change-Id: I412c310af40c4053451a2b9b4f8fcd741a85939a
Closes-Bug: 1751302
(cherry picked from commit f2afcdd00271a8dde18e521a362bd8f7953a69c1)

num_phy_cores_per_numa_node_for_pmd default value needs to be reduced

huge_page_allocation_percentage default value needs to be reduced
from 90 because in some cases where we do not have enough memory
for some hosts

Closes-Bug: #1736713
(cherry picked from commit 913444d8547c6850ce74f0bbbf84045b88afca22)

commit_message:
Update default value for derive params workflow inputs

This change is to update the default value for derive params
workflow inputs num_phy_cores_per_numa_node_for_pmd
and huge_page_allocation_percentage.
num_phy_cores_per_numa_node_for_pmd default value needs to be reduced
to 1 and cannot use more than 1 because of multi-queues.
huge_page_allocation_percentage default value needs to be reduced
from 90 because in some cases where we do not have enough memory
for some hosts

Change-Id: I8620f07f09337d0d63198c3168fec00f16262a63
Closes-Bug: #1736713
(cherry picked from commit 913444d8547c6850ce74f0bbbf84045b88afca22)

subject: bootstrap-host: Prepare disk for machinectl storage

[{'created': '2018-03-14 18:15:08.000000000', 'message': "bootstrap-host: Prepare disk for machinectl storage

Currently we prepare an available secondary disk, but do not
use it. The preparation taking place now was useful when the
backing file system for LXC was 'dir', but it is now machinectl
which uses a btrfs partition instead.

This patch implements the preparation of a btrfs sparse file
if there is no secondary disk, or the preparation of a secondary
btrfs disk if there is one.

The user_variables override for lxc_host_machine_volume_size
is removed as the default value in the role is perfectly adequate
for AIO deployment needs.

issues if they arise.

Change-Id: Icadbcfd420bbe7c14a04606790cab09a1dce03ce
(cherry picked from commit 882d98c94b6e429dec9d66d26722ed457e3b18b9)

commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Prepare disk for machinectl storage

Currently we prepare an available secondary disk, but do not
use it. The preparation taking place now was useful when the
backing file system for LXC was 'dir', but it is now machinectl
which uses a btrfs partition instead.

This patch implements the preparation of a btrfs sparse file
if there is no secondary disk, or the preparation of a secondary
btrfs disk if there is one.

The user_variables override for lxc_host_machine_volume_size
is removed as the default value in the role is perfectly adequate
for AIO deployment needs.

We also add some diagnostic information to help troubleshoot
issues if they arise.

Change-Id: Icadbcfd420bbe7c14a04606790cab09a1dce03ce
(cherry picked from commit 882d98c94b6e429dec9d66d26722ed457e3b18b9)

DellEMC SC: Added timeout to REST calls

Added a simple 30 second timeout to the rest calls to the Dell EMC
StorageCenter API.

commit_message:
Add retries to apt cache update

Updating the apt cache sometimes fails due to it being
an operation that uses mirrors on the internet. The
task should be retried to reduce the chance of a
transient failure causing the playbook to fail.

Change-Id: Ia53420dc3c19928afdc0740328b77aacee697f1d
Partial-Bug: #1750656

[{'created': '2018-03-15 16:20:18.000000000', 'message': "Use constraints for all pip package installations

Currently we're installing pip packages into the venv
unconstrained, resulting in the possibility of an
inconsistent build. This has luckily been covered by
the repo build process only making a single, correct
version of a python package available. However, for
role tests it is now failing because it's pulling in
a new version of libvirt-python which doesn't work
with the libvirt version used in newton.

Change-Id: I1607685ac6b30b698dacf5f05c4f5639ae53df44
"}]
commit_message:
Use constraints for all pip package installations

Currently we're installing pip packages into the venv
unconstrained, resulting in the possibility of an
inconsistent build. This has luckily been covered by
the repo build process only making a single, correct
version of a python package available. However, for
role tests it is now failing because it's pulling in
a new version of libvirt-python which doesn't work
with the libvirt version used in newton.

Change-Id: I1607685ac6b30b698dacf5f05c4f5639ae53df44

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 09:15:44.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure leader settings on charm upgrade

Currently bootstrapping is gated by is_leader_bootstrapped which
checks a handful of leader settings. When upgrading from older
versions of the charm, these settings are missing leading to an
attempt to bootstrap an already bootstrapped cluster.

This change makes sure the leader settings is_leader_bootstrapped is
checking for are all set by the leader on upgrade-charm.

Closes-Bug: #1755507

Change-Id: I172f10221b9447ca3e0c5403feaa49acccfa9e42
(cherry picked from commit 5bce1985e1fdc590a96050be7f35ea9a6d5358e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure leader settings on charm upgrade

Currently bootstrapping is gated by is_leader_bootstrapped which
checks a handful of leader settings. When upgrading from older
versions of the charm, these settings are missing leading to an
attempt to bootstrap an already bootstrapped cluster.

This change makes sure the leader settings is_leader_bootstrapped is
checking for are all set by the leader on upgrade-charm.

Closes-Bug: #1755507

Change-Id: I172f10221b9447ca3e0c5403feaa49acccfa9e42
(cherry picked from commit 5bce1985e1fdc590a96050be7f35ea9a6d5358e3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 15:27:18.000000000', 'message': "Update modules to contain core.py for Sphinx

Apparently Sphinx will now ignore modules that *only* contain an
__init__.py file, regardless of sub-directories being present. This
commit simply adds a core.py file to the directory with a FIXME that
explains its existance. This is just to get the documentation jobs
passing until we can refactor those modules to a point where Sphinx
doesn't ignore them.

Change-Id: I9286574334464b2ff56ae82ad5bf85c8d995a852
"}]
commit_message:
Update modules to contain core.py for Sphinx

Apparently Sphinx will now ignore modules that *only* contain an
__init__.py file, regardless of sub-directories being present. This
commit simply adds a core.py file to the directory with a FIXME that
explains its existance. This is just to get the documentation jobs
passing until we can refactor those modules to a point where Sphinx
doesn't ignore them.

Change-Id: I9286574334464b2ff56ae82ad5bf85c8d995a852

commit_message:
Add version and git sha to debug modal

We add the 'version' and 'gitSha' keys to the AppConfig record, and we
implement the appropriate selectors.  The old webpack version loader is
repurposed into a DefinePlugin which we use to define the VERSION and
GITSHA variables.  Those are read during store hydration, and their
values are stored in the app state.

Change-Id: I9fbef9c62c150aa89bc44bfb8065976a73efde25
Closes-Bug: #1731972

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 16:10:00.000000000', 'message': 'Move neutron to requirements.txt

Neutron was added to global-requirements [1] which breaks the tox
install of neutron. Neutron is now listed in requirements.txt and has
been removed as a dependency in tox.ini. One side effect is that we
based the policy.json path on the location of the neutron git directory
which is no longer the case. The test code has been updated to reflect
the new location of the policy file.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550475/

Change-Id: Ibc42b8a835d1a5e6ce09640f5bdf833c2171a9a9
'}]
commit_message:
Move neutron to requirements.txt

Neutron was added to global-requirements [1] which breaks the tox
install of neutron. Neutron is now listed in requirements.txt and has
been removed as a dependency in tox.ini. One side effect is that we
based the policy.json path on the location of the neutron git directory
which is no longer the case. The test code has been updated to reflect
the new location of the policy file.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550475/

Change-Id: Ibc42b8a835d1a5e6ce09640f5bdf833c2171a9a9

messages: [{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-03-14 18:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-03-14 18:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2018-03-15 13:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 18:15:55.000000000', 'message': '[FFU] For deployed server in CI, make sure to get the compta layer.

Not adding this template lead to a change in the control port ip
address, because name has changed and resource has become a nested
one.

The deployed_server variable is set in the featureset of the upstream
jobs.

Change-Id: I22ef4bd08e1b1fb7545b4a2eca8b55ca6081c3bd
'}]
commit_message:
[FFU] For deployed server in CI, make sure to get the compta layer.

Not adding this template lead to a change in the control port ip
address, because name has changed and resource has become a nested
one.

The deployed_server variable is set in the featureset of the upstream
jobs.

Change-Id: I22ef4bd08e1b1fb7545b4a2eca8b55ca6081c3bd

commit_message:
Wire up --skip-tags to the overcloud upgrade cli

This is already wired into the ansible-action [1] so this review just
adds skip_tags to the update_nodes workflow which calls that
action. There is a related review in the tripleoclient
Ie7fb8d9a388c6d53a31800406b03ddb8ed426401 that exposes
--skip-tags to the operator and passes it here, and that review
will depend on this one.

[1]  https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/4739027b9eaf3dc895b29b67dbca0ffc79b36d4b/tripleo_common/actions/ansible.py#L259
Change-Id: I8544de64d3307e3dc925c1cecf2d9156e31d25a8

commit_message:
Check for conflict before bumping subnet's revision number

All updates method should check if the transaction was actually
committed prior to bumping the revision number on an update. The subnet
guard code was missing.

Change-Id: I8f9b5e3c6dba6ea7e3d46fdf11421e2db160bd35
(cherry picked from commit f8fd94e978a4c823800cc7d15b1afa5584dc3481)

commit_message:
Ensure mtu is set correctly on ctlplane

We were not passing the MTU when we create the ctlplane network so if
the local_mtu is less than 1500, 1500 is used by the ctlplane network in
neutron.

Change-Id: Ic7a4c5a62ff49b2f8964dd58bf5c97d9781c4ce1
Related-Bug: #1754036
(cherry picked from commit 1bc7a07decc6e4ace5115711707a69d80b969b5f)

Adds a new run_update_ansible_action function in utils to be used by
the upgrade and update to avoid repetition. The package_update action is
passed into the utils function to avoid circular dependency.

commit_message:
Refactor some common code between overcloud_upgrade and update

Adds a new run_update_ansible_action function in utils to be used by
the upgrade and update to avoid repetition. The package_update action is
passed into the utils function to avoid circular dependency.

Change-Id: Idbe0a98fa8f2e8dfe220796c02593a805942b0da
(cherry picked from commit c6fed1f62da165ed14eff1b60a64ac5677404615)

[{'created': '2018-02-14 11:33:11.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Take mixed upgrade into account for boostrap_subnode_minimal.

In mixed upgrade, we have to check the UPGRADE_RELEASE to know the
version of the overcloud.

I add the newton version in there as it's needed for Fast Forward
Upgrade testing.

WIP: currently I've got timeout in the deployment of mixed version.
The overcloud is not deployed.  As it's a timeout we don't have full
log.  Testing if that patch help.  Meanwhile I'll be interested if
that makes sense.

Change-Id: Ib34fc0220883c2dc02884e0f09a3c87980089438

commit_message:
Take mixed upgrade into account for boostrap_subnode_minimal.

In mixed upgrade, we have to check the UPGRADE_RELEASE to know the
version of the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ib34fc0220883c2dc02884e0f09a3c87980089438

commit_message:
Revert "Suppress more stats tasks"

This currently breaks the jobs as now no_log strips the stats result.

This reverts commit d3106720d22eed7861e14b746e36715adc2933ee.

Change-Id: Ie0796a68b7173c6ccc6a8e8a879f08b231bba368

Yes, I would probably do the race checking after this patch : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/546660/ since we would be removing the node and provider records completely, the chances of new instances getting spawned are less. commit_message:
Extending delete_cell --force to delete instance_mappings

Currently the nova-manage delete_cell command with the --force option
allows us to destroy hosts_mappings of the cell which does not have any
instances or instance_mappings. This patch extends this command with the
--force option for destroying instance_mappings in addition to the
host_mappings of the cell which is to be deleted. Note that the instance
mappings and host mappings are only removed if there are no living
instances in the cell. So a --force delete here will not work if there
are non-deleted instances.

Change-Id: Ibefa0465224bec9a22431c7d3b5c8f5d91fc7732
Closes-Bug: #1745375

commit_message:
Add spec for using os-client-config for service clients

It pains me to see nova expending as much effort as it does to talk to
other services. It shouldn't be that hard - and it doesn't have to be.
If we can give our end users functions like "get_legacy_client('image')"
and have them Just Work, it seems mean to withold that sort of love from
our own developers.

Spec for blueprint use-os-client-config

Change-Id: I10b9e4c91aef790fc6e4a009a9cb9657ecf5f6bb

clustered services.

'}, {'created': '2018-02-22 02:55:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra-specs to the flavor show and detail API calls

Currently the response of ``GET /flavors/details`` and
``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}`` does not include ``extra_spces`` field,
The users have to call ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/extra_specs`` again
to get the extra_specs field.

UIs and SDKs like ``shade`` could time out before all the flavors and
extra-specs are retrieved.

This spec proposed to add a new microversion to the following APIs to
return also ``extra-specs`` of the flavor.

* GET /flavors/details
* GET /flavors/{flavor_id}

commit_message:
Add extra-specs to the flavor show and detail API calls

Currently the response of ``GET /flavors/details`` and
``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}`` does not include ``extra_spces`` field,
The users have to call ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/extra_specs`` again
to get the extra_specs field.

UIs and SDKs like ``shade`` could time out before all the flavors and
extra-specs are retrieved.

This spec proposed to add a new microversion to the following APIs to
return also ``extra-specs`` of the flavor.

* GET /flavors/details
* GET /flavors/{flavor_id}

APIImpact

Implements: blueprint add-extra-specs-to-flavor-list

Change-Id: I0a80ce5f8327bf62766e9d47442c013c0f253737

commit_message:
[Docs] Move the upgrade reference into reference

Now that the upgrade should have moved to the operations guide,
the upgrade reference should head in th reference guide.

In order to accomodate the new data into reference, the reference
landing page now links to both inventory and upgrades.

Change-Id: Ieb3eb0627854b80a7fed532702b77a7ec9a36e64

commit_message:
Nova: Fix sudoers location in nova-etc configmap

The nova_sudoers entry in the nova configmap-etc was consuming
the neutron_sudoers entry in the values.yaml. This corrects it to
point at nova_sudoers instead

Change-Id: I621c817c579cc1c31fa51b1a0f49a43a652784a2

[Docs] Flatten out monitoring

Monitoring has no content, and doesn't need subfiles.

Change-Id: I951a7c4b063fb606c2221b59294d19ffbcd32d6d
